snippet: Many who knew Joel Morales, 12, in and out of school, said he had been often been a subject of harsh treatment from peers.
abstract: Family of 12-year-old Joel Morales, who hung himself in his East Harlem home, say he had often been the subject of harsh bullying from his schoolmates; series of suicides of young boys and girls around the country has brought the subject of bullying to the forefront in recent years.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WILSON and JULIET LINDERMAN

lead_paragraph: Many who knew Joel Morales, 12, in and out of school, said he had been often been a subject of harsh treatment from peers.

headline.seo: Bullying May Have Affected Boy, 12, Who Hanged Himself
headline.main: Family of Boy, 12, Who Hanged Himself Points to Bullying
headline.print_headline: Family of Boy, 12, Who Hanged Himself Points to Bullying
